Tucson calmly responds to Talon's transmission.

"I copy you Talon, how are=
 the other Fuzors?"

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug =
22, 2011, at 8:25 PM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

>=
 Talon:
>  
> "Talon to base, answer"said Talon by comlink
>  
> To: nbwrpg=
@yahoogroups.com
> From: magicquartz@...
> Date: Mon, 22 Aug 2011 19:=
10:52 -0400
> Subject: Re: Maximals - Ark Medbay
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson transfor=
ms into robot mode and quietly sighs.
> 
> " I have made many mistakes.  Ye=
s allowing Straight Shot to stick up for herself looked wrong and you are r=
ight to question that.  But why should it be wrong to defend one self again=
st harassing ridicule?  I would not have stood for her behavior if I did no=
t see a cause for her displeasure.  Master Yokitron would always remind me =
that discipline had to come from the victim of wrong doing rather than outs=
ide reprimand in order to work effectively.  To you and others my methods a=
re untraditional, and that is valid cause for concern.  Leo I am not like e=
veryone else.  Even as an Autobot I was considered a somewhat renegade of t=
he faction.  I thought well off the pavement.  And I have a very unpredicta=
ble reputation.  I have not lost that reputation Leo Prime.  And I am no me=
ans perfect.  And if revoking my leadership is what they are here to do the=
n they have every right to do so.  I am not the average Maximal AKA Autobot=
.  I am too much of a rebel and I do best on my own accord.  
> 
> He was r=
eady for consequences as he waits for Leo's reaction.
> 
> Perpetually on t=
he move and constantly busy. 
> 
> On Aug 22, 2011, at 5:48 PM, Super Cyclo=
nus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
> 
>  
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson meets =
Leo Prime's expression with an angry stare of his own. His
> > tail continu=
es to snap in an agitated manner yet he doesn't lash out in full
> > dracon=
ic fury, as it would seem.
> >
> > " I seriously hope you are not intending=
 to undermine me Leo. "
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME carefully said nothing as=
 he waited for everyone to leave
> the room. He glanced over and saw QUICKS=
TRIDE coming in to check in on
> UPROAR. With a deft movement LEO pushed a =
button closing off the side
> of the medbay he was on from the side that QU=
ICKSTRIDE and UPROAR were
> on, and then darkned the lgass for privacy. If =
QUICKSTRIDE wanted to
> leave there was a secondary door for that.
> 
> Fin=
ally LEO turned to TUSCON as he folded his arms behind his back.
> TUSCON w=
as larger than LEO, and yet there was no fear in LEO's optics
> as he caref=
ully examined him, noting the changes that have occured
> because of his ne=
w beast mode.
> 
> "Undermine you?" LEO PRIME said finally, his voice neutr=
al and yet a
> curious lilt to it. "You allowed your subordinates, your fam=
ily as you
> say, to intentionally try to harm another Maximal or Autobot."=
 He
> paused as he shifted his gaze to the map of the jungle scene for a
> =
moment. "Under normal circumstances that would be automatic
> disciplinary =
action. An assault on a fellow soldier and you allowed
> it?"
> 
> While LE=
O PRIME's voice was low, there was a controlled power in it,
> an anger of =
his own held in powerful check. "The council has not sent
> a single mech t=
o ancient Earth in years, and now all of a sudden you
> get nine?" He tilte=
d his head as he watched for changes in expression,
> "Have you any idea wh=
y that might be?"
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> 
> 
> 
>

<div>Tucson transforms into robot mode and quietly sighs.</d=
iv>
<div><br></div>
<div>" I have made many mistakes.  Yes allowing St=
raight Shot to stick up for herself looked wrong and you are right to quest=
ion that.  But why should it be wrong to defend one self against haras=
sing ridicule?  I would not have stood for her behavior if I did not s=
ee a cause for her displeasure.  Master Yokitron would always remind m=
e that discipline had to come from the victim of wrong doing rather than ou=
tside reprimand in order to work effectively.  To you and others my me=
thods are untraditional, and that is valid cause for concern.  Leo I a=
m not like everyone else.  Even as an Autobot I was considered a somew=
hat renegade of the faction.  I thought well off the pavement.  A=
nd I have a very unpredictable reputation.  I have not lost that reput=
ation Leo Prime.  And I am no means perfect.  And if revoking my =
leadership is what they are here to do then they have every right to do so.=
  I am not the average Maximal AKA Autobot.  I am too much of a r=
ebel and I do best on my own accord.  </div>
<div><br></div>
<div>He w=
as ready for consequences as he waits for Leo's reaction.<br><br>Perpetuall=
y on the move and constantly busy. </div>

The council has not sent<br>a single mech to ancient Earth in years, and no=

anges in expression,<br>"Have you any idea why that might be?"<br><br>(TAG)=
